etymology.interpretation: Refers to porridge made from oats; 燕麦 names the grain, historically associated with the northern state of 燕. Emphasizes the ingredient rather than the cooking method.
etymology.simplification: Only 麥 was simplified to 麦 by reducing strokes in the grain component; 燕 and 粥 are unchanged.

parts.english: swallow (bird); State of Yān (ancient); surname; northern region around Yan
wheat; cereal grains; barley (as in 大麦); malt
porridge; congee; gruel; thin cereal soup

examples.chinese: 早上喝一碗热腾腾的燕麦粥最暖胃(早上喝一碗熱騰騰的燕麥粥最暖胃)。
examples.pinyin: Zǎoshang hē yì wǎn rè téngténg de yànmài zhōu zuì nuǎnwèi.
examples.english: A hot bowl of oatmeal porridge in the morning warms the stomach.

examples.chinese: 用牛奶煮燕麦粥，更香更顺滑(用牛奶煮燕麥粥，更香更順滑)。
examples.pinyin: Yòng niúnǎi zhǔ yànmài zhōu, gèng xiāng gèng shùnhuá.
examples.english: Cooking oatmeal porridge with milk makes it more fragrant and smoother.

examples.chinese: 燕麦粥富含膳食纤维，有助于保持饱腹感(燕麥粥富含膳食纖維，有助於保持飽腹感)。
examples.pinyin: Yànmài zhōu fùhán shànshí xiānwéi, yǒuzhù yú bǎochí bǎofùgǎn.
examples.english: Oatmeal porridge is rich in dietary fiber and helps maintain a feeling of fullness.
